alert.note: Alert for Coastal Miami Dade County; Far South Miami-Dade County; Inland Miami-Dade County; Metropolitan Miami Dade (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Miami-Dade County through 415 PM EDT... At 338 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Florida City to Homestead Base. Movement was north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Homestead, Homestead Miami Speedway, Black Point, Homestead General Airport, The Redland, Kendall, Pinecrest, Florida City, Homestead Base, Naranja, Glenvar Heights, Richmond West, Richmond Heights, Country Walk, Kendale Lakes, Leisure City, Palmetto Bay, Cutler Bay, Zoo Miami and Goulds. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: These winds can down small tree limbs and branches, and blow around unsecured small objects. Seek shelter in a safe building until the storm passes. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
